sentence: In 1994, Johnson founded Perry Johnson Registrars, a Troy-based company that audits and certifies other firms as meeting international standards for quality management systems.

sentence: The poll also found that Kevin Rinke holds five percent of the vote, Tudor Dixon and Ryan Kelly have four percent, and Perry Johnson and Mike Brown hold three percent.

sentence: The recommendations immediately transformed the race in the battleground state and dealt a major blow to former Detroit Police Chief James Craig, who has led in polling despite campaign problems, and businessman Perry Johnson, who has spent millions of his own money to run.
